title: Rio 2016: No viral testing of sewage-filled Olympic waters
text: Rio 2016: No viral testing of sewage-filled Olympic waters - WQOW TV: Eau Claire, WI NEWS18 News, Weather, and Sports Member Center:       As   As   Police:   Army veteran fights off man threatening children with knives A 75-year-old Army veteran who fought off a knife-wielding man who was threatening to kill children at an Illinois library is recovering from his injuries. More >> A 75-year-old Army veteran who fought off a knife-wielding man who was threatening to kill children at an Illinois library says training he received nearly five decades ago helped him in the scuffle.   Family of boy shot by Ohio officer seeks special prosecutor Lawyers for the family of a 12-year-old black boy who was carrying a pellet gun when he was fatally shot by a white police officer have made an emphatic call for a special prosecutor to take over an investigation... More >> Lawyers for the family of a 12-year-old black boy who was carrying a pellet gun when he was fatally shot by a white police officer have made an emphatic call for a special prosecutor to take over an investigation they say... More >> Muddy mess left in wake of Southern California thunderstorms A section of Southern California found itself waist-deep in mud as the weekend arrived, and a highway overtaken with by flowing debris looked like a buried junkyard of hundreds of cars that would likely take days... More >> A section of Southern California found itself waist-deep in mud as the weekend arrived, and a highway overtaken with by flowing debris looked like a buried junkyard of hundreds of cars that would likely take days to dig up. More >> Ex-CNN couple sue Motel 6 after shooting in Albuquerque A pair of former CNN journalists are suing Motel 6 after a man tried to rob the couple at gunpoint and the encounter led to an exchange of gunfire that wounded one of the former reporters. More >> Two former CNN journalists are suing Motel 6, saying one of the budget chain's Albuquerque inns didn't do enough to ensure their safety the night a man tried to rob them and an exchange of gunfire ensued. More >> Mud covers highways, strands drivers in Southern California Emergency crews shoveled mud from a section of Interstate 5 north of Los Angeles after flash flood debris blocked the important roadway, stranded hundreds of vehicles, and forced some motorists to take refuge on... More >> Rescuers threw ladders and tarps across mud up to 6 feet deep to help hundreds of trapped people from cars that got caught in a roiling river of mud along a major Southern California trucking route, a California Highway... More >>
